intro: Tropilis × suffusa, commonly known as the hybrid orchid, is a fascinating plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Tropilis lutea and Tropilis tenuifolia, exhibiting a blend of characteristics from both parent species. The plant is known for its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of rare orchids.
